The Executive Committee of the NHAI has decided to approve the following revised procedures for dealing with (A) Arbitration matters, and (B) Court cases relating to Contractual Disputes/ Claims in its meeting held on 01.06.2017 in supersession of all earlier instructions on the subject: (A) Standard Operating Procedure (SoP) for handling the Arbitration matters 1 Compliance of pre-requisites before invoking arbitration: It has to be ensured that the requisite process (as given below) before taking recourse to the operation of arbitration clause is complied with. 1.1 Item Rate Contracts: The Conditions of Particular Application (CoPA) of the Agreement provide for referring the dispute by either party initially to a Dispute Review Expert (DRE) Dispute Adjudication Board (DABJ Dispute Review Board (DRB) for giving its recommendation. If either party is dis-satisfied with such recommendation or if the DREI DABI DRB fails to give its recommendation within the prescribed time (56 days or 84 days, as specified in the Agreement) ; then either party may issue notice to the other party on or before expiry of the prescribed time (14 days or 28 days, as given in the agreement) with a copy to the Engineer to convey its intention to commence arbitration: If the DREI DABI DRB gives its recommendation and no notice of intention to commence arbitration has been given by either party within the prescribed time, the recommendation of DREI DABI DRB shall become final and binding: (iv) Therefore, the PD concerned shall submit a proposal to the RO, with a copy to Technical Division at HQ, within 5 days of receipt of recommendation of DREI DABI DRB clearly as to whether to accept the recommendation or invoke arbitration along with the justification supporting the view taken by him: The Regional Officer (RO) concerned shall give his clear recommendations along with the justification to the Member concerned at HQ within 5 days of receipt of proposal from the Project Director (PD).
